intro: Tithymalus semivillosus, commonly known as the rough tithymalus, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun. Its leaves are covered in fine, short hairs, giving it a rough texture. The flowers are usually yellow or orange, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
